questions.text: A young man came to the medical OPD with complaints of early morning backache and stiffness, which improves on exercise, and persistent red eyes. On examination, lung expansion was less than 3 cm. X-ray is shown in the image given below. What is the most probable diagnosis & which type of joint is involved?
questions.correct_answer: B. Ankylosing spondylitis & secondary cartilagenous joint
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Ankylosing spondylitis & secondary cartilagenous joint

questions.text: A patient is brought to the OPD by his wife complaining about difficulty in expressing emotions and not taking part in daily activities. On examination, resting tremors and rigidity are noted. Given the possible diagnosis, which part of the brain is affected in this patient?

A male patient presents with sensory loss and weakness of limbs for 3 months. He also has angular stomatitis. On examination, there is loss of proprioception, vibration sensations, UMN type of lower limb weakness, and absent ankle reflex. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: D. Subacute combined degeneration of cord
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Subacute combined degeneration of cord

questions.text: A 78-year-old woman presents with a progressive decline in daily activity. She gives a history of convulsions and visual hallucinations. She does not talk to anyone and keeps looking at the sky. Pathological examination shows the presence of Lewy bodies within the neurons. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 65-year-old chronic smoker came to the medicine outpatient department with complaints of upper chest discomfort and drooping of an eyelid. He also complained of pain radiating to the upper arm and a tingling sensation in the 4th and 5th digits of his left hand. The chest X-ray is given below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

In the anatomical arrangement of intermuscular spaces such as the cubital fossa, femoral triangle, anatomical snuff box, etc., what primarily forms the roof of these spaces? Skin Superficial fascia Subcutaneous fat, cutaneous nerves, and vessels Deep fascia

A 28-year-old male presents with anterior knee pain that worsens with activities like running and jumping. On physical examination, there is tenderness and swelling over the front of the knee. Palpation reveals a small, round, bony prominence at the centre of the knee. The patient reports no recent trauma. You will put the involved bone in which of the following types?

A 21-year-old patient, Suyash, came to the OPD with a history of a fall on his hand. Now, he is experiencing pain in the hand region. The X-ray of the patient is given. Which of the following joints is shown in the X-ray?
What is the typical fiber arrangement of lumbrical muscles in the hand?

A 32-year-old woman presents to the emergency department after falling onto her outstretched hand. She complains of severe pain in her elbow. Physical examination reveals swelling and tenderness over the distal humerus. An X-ray confirms a supracondylar fracture. Upon further examination, the patient is unable to flex her thumb. Which nerve is most likely involved in this patient's presentation?

A 40-year-old male patient was admitted with complaints of acute pain in the right shoulder of three-days duration associated with swelling, and he also had difficulty in using his right shoulder since then. Pain was sudden at onset, continuous, and moderate to severe in intensity, aggravated on activity. He had severe night and rest pain. He also gave a history of intramuscular injection of iron in the right deltoid region 2 weeks previously, which was administered in a local clinic. On examination, there was a globular swelling in the lateral aspect of the right arm extending up to the scapular region. There was a local rise of temperature and tenderness over the swelling, painful restriction of right shoulder movements, and he could not abduct his arm to the right angle. An MRI scan of the right shoulder showed pyomyositis of the posterior belly of the right deltoid muscle with central abscess formation. Which among the following is not a possible complication that can be expected in this case if untreated?

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of sensation on lower lateral aspect of arm

options.label: C
options.text: Weak flexion of arm at shoulder joint

options.label: D
options.text: Inability to extend the arm at shoulder joint

questions.correct_answer: A. Loss of sensation on lower lateral aspect of arm
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Loss of sensation on lower lateral aspect of arm

questions.text: All of the following muscles have dual nerve supply except?

A 45-year-old man with a history of prolonged crutch use due to a leg injury presents with weakness in his hand. He reports difficulty extending his wrist and fingers and a decreased sensation on the back of his hand. These symptoms have progressively worsened over the past few weeks. Which of the following structures is most likely affected in this patient?

A 45-year-old office worker complains of persistent wrist pain and difficulty performing repetitive tasks on a computer keyboard. Physical examination reveals tenderness at the wrist joint and decreased range of motion, particularly during wrist flexion and extension. Radiographic evaluation shows evidence of degenerative changes in the joint space. Which of the following bones is not directly involved in the formation of the wrist joint?

A 65-year-old patient with a history of hypertension and diabetes is admitted to the hospital with complaints of weakness in the hand and difficulty holding objects. The patient's medical history includes a recent cerebrovascular accident (CVA). A "card test" is performed as part of the neurological examination. Which of the following muscle groups is primarily assessed with this test to check for motor function in the hand?

A 60-year-old patient presents to the orthopedic clinic with complaints of progressive weakness in his right hand. The patient reports difficulty in fine movements of the hand. The doctor performed a test over the patient, as shown in the image. Which of the following statements is true about the given image?

options.label: A
options.text: The median nerve of the right hand is injured.

options.label: B
options.text: There is weakness of thenar muscles on the right side.

options.label: C
options.text: The adductor pollicis of the right side is weak.

options.label: D
options.text: The flexor muscles of the thumb of the right hand are weak.

questions.correct_answer: C. The adductor pollicis of the right side is weak.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The adductor pollicis of the right side is weak.

questions.text: A 75-year-old female presented to the medicine OPD with complaints of numbness over her little finger of the right hand. On examination, there was total loss of cutaneous sensation over the palmar and dorsal surface of the little finger of the right hand. Which of the following nerves is probably injured?

A 40-year-old man presents with a complaint of dragging his foot while walking. On examination, he demonstrates difficulty in dorsiflexing his foot at the ankle. This clinical presentation is most likely due to a lesion affecting which nerve?

A 47-year-old obese man felt a snap in his right lower leg while playing squash and couldn’t continue the game further. He reached the emergency department with complaints of acute severe pain in his right lower leg and heel. The physician confirmed a diagnosis of an acute right Achilles tendon rupture, and the patient was immediately posted for open reparative surgery. Which of the following statements is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It causes dorsiflexion of the foot at the ankle joint

options.label: B
options.text: It is supplied by the superficial peroneal nerve

options.label: C
options.text: It is the strongest tendon of the human body

options.label: D
options.text: It inserts into the upper third of calcaneus

questions.correct_answer: C. It is the strongest tendon of the human body
questions.explanation: Ans. C) It is the strongest tendon of the human body

questions.text: A 22-year-old male athlete sustained an injury to his foot during one of his practice sessions. The given image is the x-ray of his foot. Which of the following statements is true pertaining to the given image?

options.label: A
options.text: It is fracture of first metatarsal base

options.label: B
options.text: It is a fracture of fifth metatarsal base

options.label: C
options.text: The tuberosity of the pointed bone in the above image is least vascular

options.label: D
options.text: Its metadiaphyseal region receives the insertion of peroneus tertius tendon

questions.correct_answer: B. It is a fracture of fifth metatarsal base
questions.explanation: Ans.  B) It is a fracture of fifth metatarsal base

questions.text: A 22-year-old athlete presents with pain in the posterior aspect of his hip after a sprinting injury. On examination, the pain is localized to the ischial tuberosity. Which of the following muscles is most likely involved, given its attachment to the ischial tuberosity?

A 60-year-old patient presented with a sagging face, asymmetrical smile, facial muscle tone with drooping of the left angle of the mouth, and inability to blow properly. Which nerve is involved in this case?
Injury to the nerve that lies medially to the structure pointed will result in?

options.label: A
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

options.label: B
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from posterior 1/3 tongue

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of general sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of taste sensation from posterior most part of tongue

questions.correct_answer: A. Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Loss of taste sensation from anterior 2/3 tongue

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The chorda tympani branch of the facial nerve provides taste sensation to the anterior two-thirds of the tongue by joining the lingual nerve from the mandibular division (V3) of the trigeminal nerve.

questions.text: A 28-year-old male sustained a head injury due to a fall from his bike. CT brain showed an extradural hematoma. The blood vessel injured is:
A 57-year-old man underwent parotidectomy, following which he complained that there was a loss of sensation while shaving. Which nerve is affected most?

A student after a heavy lunch from the hostel got ready for his afternoon class. He sat in the first bench and began to take notes. After a while, he yawned widely. To his surprise, sadly he could not close his mouth. The jaw was stuck. Which of the following statements is not true in the above scenario?

options.label: A
options.text: This is a case of anterior dislocation of temporomandibular joint

options.label: B
options.text: Temporomandibular joint is a bicondylar type of synovial joint

options.label: C
options.text: Contraction of medial pterygoid depresses the mandible

options.label: D
options.text: Sphenomandibular ligament is situated medial to temporomandibular joint

questions.correct_answer: C. Contraction of medial pterygoid depresses the mandible
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Contraction of medial pterygoid depresses the mandible

questions.text: Identify the epithelium
Identify the cell
Muscle used for Tendon grafting operation in lower limb is?
Achalasia cardia is due to
questions.correct_answer: B. Abnormality in neural crest cells
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Abnormality in neural crest cells

questions.text: Morphine acts on
Which of the following is incorrect option?

options.label: A
options.text: A & B are not having any nuclei but C is having nuclei

options.label: B
options.text: B forms anterior boundary of interpeduncular fossa & C is not the content of interpeduncular fossa

options.label: C
options.text: Chief sensory nucleus of trigeminal nerve is situated in D & Corticospinal tract passes through E

options.label: D
options.text: XIII cranial nerve is situated near A, XII cranial nerve is attached between E & F while IX, X & XI cranial nerve are attached behind F

questions.correct_answer: B. B forms anterior boundary of interpeduncular fossa & C is not the content of interpeduncular fossa
questions.explanation: Ans. B) B forms anterior boundary of interpeduncular fossa & C is not the content of interpeduncular fossa

questions.text: Vth ventricle of the brain is related to:
All of the following statements regarding brain sections are correct except:

options.label: A
options.text: Lesion at C will result in Paralytic agitans & lesion at F will result in disturbance in Papez circuit

options.label: B
options.text: B is considered as 5th lobe of brain & F is considered a part of 6th lobe of brain

options.label: C
options.text: A is not the part of basal nuclei while F is not the part of Limbic system

options.label: D
options.text: D is the example of largest commissural fibre & E is afferent for the mammillary body

questions.correct_answer: C. A is not the part of basal nuclei while F is not the part of Limbic system
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A is not the part of basal nuclei while F is not the part of Limbic system

questions.text: In the given radiological anatomy image, identify the thalamus:
Lesion to indicated structure will result in paralysis of which of the following muscle:
Which of the following is the action of the indicated muscle:
In Pringle’s maneuver method, which anatomical structure is mainly compressed?
Portal vein is formed at level of?
The appearance of the colon on double contrast barium enema examination is shown in the image. Identify A, B, & C, respectively.

options.label: A
options.text: Hepatic flexure, splenic flexure, transverse colon

options.label: B
options.text: Transverse colon, Hepatic flexure, splenic flexure

options.label: C
options.text: Splenic flexure, Hepatic flexure, transverse colon

questions.correct_answer: C. Splenic flexure, Hepatic flexure, transverse colon
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Splenic flexure, Hepatic flexure, transverse colon

questions.text: At which level of the brain is the nucleus supplying the marked muscle situated?
Most lateral nucleus of cerebellum:
Kind of hernia shown in the image. Which anatomical structure is not present in the boundary of the related space?
Chassaignac’s tubercle is related with which vertebra:
Which of the following is the Widow’s artery?
Thinnest cranial nerve is:
Which nerve is most susceptible to get damage in head injury?
Identify the related syndrome.
Which type of gland is depicted here?

A 45-year-old woman is being examined as a candidate for cosmetic breast surgery. The surgeon notes that both of her breasts sag considerably. Which structure has most likely become stretched to result in this condition?

A 48-year-old female court stenographer is admitted to the orthopedic clinic with symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome, with which she has suffered for almost a year. Which muscles most typically become weakened in this condition?

Laboratory studies in the outpatient clinic on a 24-year-old female included assessment of circulating blood chemistry. Which of the following arteries is most likely at risk during venipuncture at the cubital fossa?

A 45-year-old male is admitted to the hospital with a painful arm after a “strongest man in the world” contest. Physical examination gives evidence of a rupture of the long tendon of the biceps brachii (see figure). Which of the following is the most likely location of the rupture?

options.label: C
options.text: Junction with the short head of the biceps muscle

questions.text: A 45-year-old male is treated at the hospital after he fell from his bicycle. Radiographic examination reveals fractures both of the tibia and the fibula. On physical examination, the patient has a foot drop but normal eversion (see figure). Which of the following nerves is most likely injured?

A 32-year-old man is admitted to the emergency department after an injury to his foot while playing football with his college friends. An MRI examination reveals multiple tendinous tears (see figure). Which of the following bones is associated with the muscle tears?

A 49-year-old man is admitted to the emergency department with a cold and pale foot. Physical examination reveals that the patient suffers from peripheral vascular disease and his popliteal artery is occluded, with no pulse felt upon palpation. What is the landmark to feel the pulse of the femoral artery?

During cardiac catheterization of a 6-year-old child, the radiologist notes that the contrast medium released into the arch of the aorta is visible immediately in the left pulmonary artery. What is the most likely explanation for this finding?

A 17-year-old girl is admitted to the hospital with severe dyspnea. Physical examination reveals that the patient is suffering from an asthma attack, with associated bronchospasm. Which of the following nerves is responsible for the innervation of the bronchial smooth muscle cells?

A 3-year-old male who fell from a tree complains of severe pain over the right side of his chest due to a rib fracture at the midaxillary line. He is admitted to the hospital with difficulty breathing. Radiographic and physical examinations reveal atelectasis resulting from the accumulation of blood in his pleural space, causing a hemothorax. What is the most likely source of bleeding causing the hemothorax?
Fusion of the caudal portions of the kidneys during embryonic development is most likely to result in which of the following congenital conditions?

A 54-year-old male is admitted to the emergency department with severe upper abdominal pain. Gastroscopy reveals a tumor in the antrum of the stomach. A CT scan is ordered to evaluate lymphatic drainage of the stomach. Which of the following lymph nodes is most likely to be involved in a malignancy of the stomach?

A 45-year-old male entered the emergency department with a complaint of severe abdominal pain. During physical examination, it is observed that his cremasteric reflex is absent. Which of the following nerves is responsible for the efferent limb of the cremasteric reflex?

A 42-year-old patient is admitted to the hospital after suffering a ruptured spleen in a skiing accident. Physical examination reveals intense pain that radiates to the region of the left shoulder, presumably due to irritation of the diaphragm. Which of the following signs best describes this condition?

A 68-year-old man is admitted to the hospital due to severe back pain. Radiographic examination reveals severe osteoporosis of the vertebral column, with crush fractures of vertebrae L4 and L5. Which of the following parts of the vertebrae are most likely to be fractured in this patient?

A 34-year-old woman is admitted to the emergency department after a car crash. Radiographic examination reveals a whiplash injury in addition to hyperextension of her cervical spine. Which of the following ligaments will most likely be injured?

A 55-year-old man is admitted to the hospital after an injury sustained at work in a factory. He presents with severe scalp lacerations, which were sutured. After three days, the wound is inflamed, swollen, and painful. Between which tissue layers is the infection most likely located?

options.label: C
options.text: The dense connective tissue and the aponeurosis

options.label: D
options.text: The dense connective tissue and the skin

questions.correct_answer: B. The aponeurosis and the periosteum
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The aponeurosis and the periosteum

questions.text: A 54-year-old man was admitted to the emergency department after he was struck by an automobile. Radiographic examination revealed a fracture through the crista galli of the anterior cranial fossa, resulting in slow, local bleeding. Which of the following is the most likely source of bleeding?

options.label: B
options.text: The great cerebral vein of Galen

questions.text: Identify the anomaly shown in the image:
Identify the central sulcus of Rolando:
Your patient has lost the ability to discriminate between two points presented simultaneously to the skin. Your neurological evaluation is most likely to reveal a lesion in the:
A transverse section through the brainstem contains the nucleus of Edinger-Westphal. Which other structure are you most likely to see in the same section?

Your patient has a loss of general sensation and ageusia on the posterior one third of the tongue, and touching the lateral wall of the throat fails to elicit a gag reflex. The neural structure that is the most likely to have been lesioned is the:
Your patient has a stooped posture, shuffling gait, and a tremor in the fingers at rest. Which part of the brain will show neuronal degeneration?
A patient has suffered a stroke caused by occlusion of the right anterior cerebral artery. This patient is most likely to present with:

options.label: A
options.text: A loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg

options.label: C
options.text: Drooping of the corner of the mouth on the left

questions.correct_answer: A. A loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg
questions.explanation: Ans. A) A loss of pain and temperature sensations in the left leg

questions.text: A lawyer suffers a bad fall that results in head trauma. His motor, sensory, and language skills are intact after the incident, and he has no visual problems. In the following weeks, he begins to lose interest in his work and doesn't seem to care much about his family. The trauma most likely affected the:
Which of the following cells are found in the white matter of the spinal cord?
Identify the papillae from the given histological section:
Identify the cell marked in the histological image of the cerebellum shown below:
Identify the type of cartilage shown in the image below:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Elastic cartilage

questions.text: All of the following are Not true about the given Histology?

options.label: A
options.text: The cortical portion is mainly composed of lymphocytes

options.label: C
options.text: It is derived from the fourth Pharyngeal pouch

options.label: D
options.text: It undergoes atrophy from puberty onwards

questions.correct_answer: C. It is derived from the fourth Pharyngeal pouch
questions.explanation: Ans. C) It is derived from the fourth Pharyngeal pouch

questions.text: Shown epithelium is found in?
The movements at the _________________ joint permit a person to look to the right and left.

A 40-year-old male patient presents with a swelling that has been slowly growing in the past 2 years. On examination, it was variable in consistency and fully mobile. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient presents with sudden onset of chest pain shooting to the neck and interscapular region. X-ray shows widened mediastinum. BP is 110/90 mmHg in the right upper limb and 160/100 mmHg in the left upper limb. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old patient with a history of trauma one week back presents with confusion and ataxia. He is on treatment for alcohol dependence, and his last intake was 2 weeks back. CT scan reveals the following finding. What is the diagnosis?
A 23-year-old male patient presents with midline swelling in the neck. The swelling moves with deglutition and protrusion of the tongue. What is the likely diagnosis?
Cardiac dominance is decided by:
A tumor of the uncinate process of the pancreas affects which of the following vessels?
A patient presented with clinical features of ataxia and incoordination. This is due to thrombosis of which artery?
Nerve of the anterior compartment of the thigh is:
A patient presented with the extension of MCP joint and flexion of IP joints. Which muscle is affected?
The long left recurrent laryngeal nerve is due to the persistence of which arch artery?
SSA fibres are present in which of the following cranial nerves?
Which of the following cranial nerves' nuclei shows SSA features?
GSE fibers are present in:

Which of the following are branches of the anterior division of the internal iliac artery? Superior gluteal artery Inferior gluteal artery Superior vesical artery Middle rectal artery Inferior vesical artery Vaginal artery
Fibers from the marked structure end in which of the following areas of the thalamus?

A 48-year-old female patient presented with recurrent episodes of severe abdominal pain, which is often accompanied by nausea and vomiting. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy reveals multiple peptic ulcers in the duodenal bulb. Laboratory tests show elevated gastrin levels. She was given Prilosec for a long time. She was also consuming a vegetarian diet and now presented with tiredness & palpitations since a month. She complained of progressive sensory loss in her lower extremities. Neurological examination reveals impaired vibratory sensation in both legs. An MRI of the spinal cord shows no structural abnormalities. On blood examination, the following hematological slide was found. All of the following statements are correct in this case except:

options.label: A
options.text: This is a case of gastrinoma with high gastrin secretion resulting in hypersecretion of hydrochloric acid.

options.label: B
options.text: Prilosec is an example of a proton pump inhibitor which may cause decreased Vitamin B12 absorption.

options.label: C
options.text: In this patient due to Vitamin B12 deficiency, myelination of the anterior spinothalamic tract has been affected.

options.label: D
options.text: On hematological examination, increased mean corpuscular volume (MCV >100 fL) and mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) and polymorphonuclear cells with multiple lobes are found.

questions.correct_answer: C. In this patient due to Vitamin B12 deficiency, myelination of the anterior spinothalamic tract has been affected.
questions.explanation: Ans. C) In this patient due to Vitamin B12 deficiency, myelination of the anterior spinothalamic tract has been affected.

questions.text: A 21-year-old null gravida Caucasian patient presented with a 15-month history of amenorrhea, bifrontal headache, and photophobia. Examination revealed general physical, neurologic, and ophthalmoscopic findings with normal visual fields. A pelvic examination revealed normal external genitalia, nulliparous cervix and uterus, and bilateral cystic ovarian masses measuring 8 cm in diameter on the right and 4 cm on the left. Endocrine evaluation revealed an elevated serum prolactin in the range of 48 to 50 ng/ml. This situation was related with mass in the following area of the below image:
Identify the marked structure:
